line_1: They turn'd with modest looks and shy;
line_2: He stood, he gaz'd, he came not nigh;
The wife grows flippant in reply;

line_1: Each to his dearest friend grew shy,
line_2: And none could tell the reason why.

line_1: Woo'd with long care, CURCUMA cold and shy
line_2: Meets her fond husband with averted eye:

line_1: The Britons, in their Nature shy,
line_2: View Strangers with a distant Eye:

line_1: For ever of the proffer'd parley shy,
line_2: She hears the unwelcome foot advancing nigh;

line_1: Cock of the heath, so wildly shy!
line_2: Thy crimson moon and azure eye,
